zh:
2022年是迎難而上的一年。

2022年伊始，全球經濟環境一片暗淡。新冠病毒變異株Omicron肆虐，令全球經濟增長繼續受壓，通脹壓力亦持續上升。其後俄羅斯與烏克蘭爆發衝突，進一步推高通脹壓力，導致各主要央行採取前置式貨幣緊縮政策，擴大環球金融市場的波動，並加劇經濟增長放緩的風險。本地方面，第五波疫情爆發，感染個案急速上升，亦進一步打擊經濟。同時，圍繞防疫措施與檢疫限制的負面報道，更令外界對香港產生誤解，威脅香港作為國際金融中心的聲譽。全年計，香港實質本地生產總值收縮了3.5%。

儘管面對重重挑戰，金管局繼續致力保障香港貨幣與金融穩定，並於主要策略範疇推進多項有利發展的措施，進一步鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位。經歷3年的旅遊限制後，我們成功向國際社會展示香港已全面復常，旅客亦能再次親身訪港體驗。金管局在去年11月舉辦「國際金融領袖投資峰會」，來自世界各地的金融領袖親身來港出席。外界如此熱烈的反應，成為印證香港全面復常最好不過的證明。

展望未來，外圍環境仍然充滿前所未有的不確定性。儘管如此，內地經濟重啟會為香港以至整個地區重新注入動力。金管局將繼續緊守崗位，履行維持香港貨幣與銀行體系穩定的職能，並積極尋求更多有利香港發展的機會，展現及提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。我們亦會繼續為提升全球氣候應變能力及可持續發展出力。今年除《二零二二年年報》外，我們會另外發表《二零二二年可持續發展報告》，以便更詳細地介紹金管局在提升香港作為綠色和可持續金融樞紐的地位所進行的各項工作，以及金管局作為負責任投資者及可持續機構所作出的努力。

# 貨幣及金融體系：堅穩如昔

聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）自1983年實施至今，歷經多個經濟周期，成功抵禦各種各樣的外來衝擊。2022年再次見證聯匯制度的抗震能力。在美國聯邦儲備局（聯儲局）大幅收緊貨幣政策下，弱方兌換保證於2022年5月至11月期間被觸發41次，金管局按照既定機制，以有序及具透明度的方式從市場買入合共2,421億港元。其間港元匯率及貨幣市場繼續運作暢順，反映聯匯制度穩健有效。

這份對聯匯制度的信心，來自於建立多年的穩固根基。正如國際貨幣基金組織在其《2022年對外部門報告》中重申，聯匯制度的公信力建基於多項因素，包括具高透明度的運作規則、充裕的外匯儲備、審慎的財政制度、穩健的金融監管，以及靈活的經濟結構。

我們深信除了穩健的機制外，致力與公眾及市場溝通以加深其對聯匯制度的了解、進行有效的市場監察，以及就不同情景作出應變計劃，均有助鞏固各界對聯匯制度的信心。我們就聯匯制度運作機制推出的社交媒體宣傳活動，有助在年內弱方兌換保證多次被觸發的情況下，有效維護市場對聯匯制度的信心。內部方面，金管局亦善用數據分析技術加強市場監察，讓我們能適時回應最新市場形勢。

年內，儘管面對宏觀層面的挑戰以及遞增的信用風險，香港銀行體系仍然維持穩健，資本及流動性均非常充裕。2022年底，本地銀行的綜合總資本充足比率為20.1%，遠高於國際最低要求的8%。2022年第4季，大型銀行的流動性覆蓋比率稍升至162.3%，亦遠高於法定最低要求的100%。鑑於信貸環境面對挑戰，銀行體系的資產質素略為轉差，特定分類貸款比率於2022年底升至1.38%，但有關水平仍屬穩健，並低於2000年以來的長期平均水平1.8%。

# 銀行體系：有效監管確保運作穩健

疫情持續3年，來自各方面的挑戰均有所加劇，例如地緣政治緊張局勢升溫及主要央行收緊貨幣政策。然而，全賴多年來妥善的風險管理及有效的監管，香港銀行體系得以維持穩健，繼續發揮支持經濟的重要作用。

過去一年面對的一項主要監管挑戰，是在第五波新冠疫情後經濟仍充滿不確定性之下，確保銀行繼續為客戶提供所需支援的同時，維持穩健的信用風險管理。「預先批核還息不還本」計劃進一步展期，並加入自願性部分本金還款選項，讓借款人可以選擇開始償還部分本金，協助客戶就最終回復正常還款作好準備。

因應主要經濟體大幅收緊貨幣政策令市場波動加劇，2022年金管局另一項主要監管工作是加強監察銀行的市場及流動性風險承擔。我們深入評估各經濟體同步收緊貨幣政策對銀行可能產生的影響，並就壓力測試引入新情景，以評估銀行應對長時間流動性壓力的韌性。

與此同時，我們繼續採取具前瞻性的措施，促進在多個範疇的有效風險管理。在運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力方面，我們提供指引協助銀行制定綜合及全面的運作架構，以達致穩健經營，並就銀行具體的運作範疇提供詳盡監管指引，例如因應雲端技術普及而就使用雲端運算提供指引。此外，因應數碼化加速發展，我們亦加強了應對「網絡釣魚」騙案和推進消費者及投資者保障的工作。

除了維持銀行體系穩健外，金管局亦致力推動普及金融及提高銀行服務的便利性。銀行對於金管局就提供基本銀行服務的呼籲反應正面，有銀行在新發展地區的大型公共屋邨增設分行及自助銀行服務設施。受到疫情相關的旅遊限制影響，許多香港市民無法使用其內地銀行戶口。有見及此，金管局與有關各方緊密合作，協助重新啓動約50萬個內地銀行戶口，受影響戶口持有人無需親身前往內地辦理。

另一個對銀行業持續發展具策略重要性的範疇是提升專業能力。為擴展業務，銀行業對專業人才的需求仍然龐大。金管局在其人才發展策略 — 「連接人才與未來」— 的基礎上，在過去一年推出多項措施，協助銀行業吸引、培育及挽留人才，集中提升及再培訓現有從業員的技能，以及培育年輕一代，以建立可持續的人才庫。

# 國際金融中心：香港重回國際舞台!

實施多時的疫情相關旅遊限制於2022年逐步撤銷，我們作出了多方面的努力讓香港重回國際舞台。11月舉行的「國際金融領袖投資峰會」吸引超過200位來自環球金融機構的國際及地區負責人親臨香港，並獲得全球各地的關注及熱切迴響。儘管峰會舉行日期不巧遇上50年來首個在11月份發出的8號颱風訊號，峰會仍然十分成功，向世界傳遞了香港已全面復常並正展現無比朝氣與活力的有力訊息。我們很高興看到峰會產生了正面的漣漪效應，不少環球金融機構及國際組織現正或計劃在香港舉辦各類活動。

除吸引各地訪客重臨香港外，我和金管局的同事體會到面對面交流聯繫的重要性，因此盡可能親身代表香港出席主要國際會議，積極參與全球政策討論，並藉外訪機會與環球金融機構的集團管理層會面，加深他們對香港穩健的金融體系以及在「一國兩制」下香港提供的各種機遇的了解。

為確保香港保持作為國際金融中心的競爭力，我們在金融科技、內地機遇，以及綠色和可持續金融等策略性重點領域不斷開拓市場新界限。我們亦進一步加強本港的金融平台，提供頂尖的服務，吸引更多企業落戶香港。有關金管局在綠色和可持續金融方面的工作詳情，請參閱《二零二二年可持續發展報告》。

# 金融科技

繼2021年6月公布「金融科技2025」策略，2022年我們在五大範疇均取得顯著進展。

我們在「全面推展銀行數碼化」方面的工作取得理想成果。根據金融科技應用評估的結果，香港銀行業在不同業務領域廣泛採用金融科技，而且所採用的科技類別亦持續增加。我們自2017年以來逐步推廣及支持數碼化的工作獲銀行積極回應，並持續取得成果，成續令人鼓舞。我們將繼續與業界緊密合作，根據評估的結果，進一步推動金融科技在特定銀行業務領域的應用及促進個別科技類別的發展。

年內我們在央行數碼貨幣方面的工作邁進重要的新里程。「多種央行數碼貨幣跨境網絡」(mBridge)項目進入試行階段，並成為全球其中一個率先為企業跨境交易進行真實結算的央行數碼貨幣項目。在零售層面，數字人民幣跨境使用的技術測試已進入第二階段，主要測試通過「轉數快」為數字人民幣錢包增值。數碼港元方面，我們將採取三軌道方式為將來可能發行數碼港元作好準備，並推出第二軌道先導計劃，邀請業界深入研究數碼港元可行的應用場景。

數據可全面釋放金融科技的潛力。我們於去年10月推出的「商業數據通」正是提升香港數據基建的重要一步。作為以數據擁有人授權為本的共享數據基建，「商業數據通」能方便金融機構提取企業的商業數據，使企業（尤其中小型企業）更容易獲得融資。截至2022年底，「商業數據通」已促成超過1,000宗中小企貸款，總額逾19億港元。

最後，我們在擁抱金融創新和它帶來的好處的同時，亦明白有必要監察及處理好相關發展可能帶來的風險。我們正密切注視虛擬資產領域的發展，並參與相關監管事宜的國際討論。經考慮公眾諮詢收集到的意見及相關國際標準後，我們將採納「相同風險，相同監管」1 的方式制定穩定幣的監管制度及界定其監管範圍。未來我們率先規管的對象將是那些標榜與一種或以上法定貨幣的價值掛鈎的穩定幣，因為這類穩定幣可能對貨幣及金融穩定帶來更高及更迫切的潛在風險。我們相信在訂立適當的規範下，業界將可更安全穩妥地開拓數碼金融的潛力。

科技正重塑我們的未來。金管局與銀行業界正積極準備迎向這個「新常態」。我們有信心我們正構建的金融科技生態圈將有助全面釋放金融科技的潛力，並提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。

en:
2022 was a year of facing challenges head-on.

At the start of 2022, the global economic environment was bleak. The Omicron variant of the novel coronavirus continued to spread, putting further pressure on global economic growth and causing inflationary pressures to persist. Subsequently, the conflict between Russia and Ukraine further intensified inflationary pressures, prompting major central banks to adopt preemptive monetary tightening policies, which increased volatility in global financial markets and heightened the risk of slowing economic growth. Locally, the fifth wave of the pandemic broke out, with a rapid rise in infection cases, further impacting the economy. Meanwhile, negative reports surrounding measures to combat the pandemic and quarantine restrictions led to misunderstandings about Hong Kong, threatening its reputation as an international financial center. For the whole year, Hong Kong’s real GDP contracted by 3.5%.

Despite facing numerous challenges, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to dedicate itself to safeguarding Hong Kong’s monetary and financial stability, and has advanced several beneficial measures across key strategic areas, further solidifying Hong Kong’s position as an international financial center. After three years of travel restrictions, we have successfully demonstrated to the international community that Hong Kong has fully returned to normal, and visitors can once again experience Hong Kong firsthand. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority hosted the “International Financial Leaders Investment Summit” in November last year, and financial leaders from around the world attended in person. This enthusiastic response from external parties is the best proof of Hong Kong’s full return to normal.

Looking ahead, the **foreign** environment remains filled with unprecedented uncertainties. Nevertheless, the mainland’s economic reopening will inject fresh impetus into Hong Kong and the entire region. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will continue to stand firm in its role, fulfilling its function of maintaining the stability of Hong Kong’s monetary and banking systems, and actively seek more opportunities beneficial to Hong Kong’s development, demonstrating and enhancing Hong Kong’s competitiveness as an international financial center. We will also continue to contribute to enhancing global climate resilience and sustainable development. This year, in addition to the “2022 Annual Report,” we will also publish the “2022 Sustainable Development Report” to provide a more detailed introduction of the HKMA’s work in enhancing Hong Kong’s position as a green and sustainable finance hub, as well as the Authority’s efforts as a responsible investor and sustainable institution.

# Monetary and Financial System: As Stable as Ever

The Linked Exchange Rate System has been in place since 1983, having withstood multiple economic cycles and successfully resisted various external shocks. In 2022, the system’s resilience was again demonstrated. Under the significant tightening of monetary policy by the US Federal Reserve, the weak-side exchange rate guarantee was triggered 41 times between May and November 2022. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) purchased a total of HKD 242.1 billion from the market in an orderly and transparent manner, according to the established mechanism. During this period, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate and money market continued to operate smoothly, reflecting the robustness and effectiveness of the Linked Exchange Rate System.

The confidence in the currency exchange system stems from a solid foundation built over many years. As the International Monetary Fund reiterated in its 2022 External Sector Report, the credibility of the exchange rate system is based on multiple factors, including highly transparent operational rules, ample foreign exchange reserves, a prudent fiscal system, sound financial regulation, and a flexible economic structure.

We firmly believe that, in addition to having a sound mechanism, efforts to communicate with the public and the market to enhance their understanding of the Linked Exchange Rate System, effective market surveillance, and contingency planning for different scenarios all contribute to strengthening confidence in the Linked Exchange Rate System. Our social media campaigns launched to promote understanding of the operational mechanisms of the Linked Exchange Rate System have helped effectively maintain market confidence in the system, even in situations where the weak-side exchange guarantee was triggered multiple times during the year. Internally, the HKMA has also made good use of data analytics technology to enhance market surveillance, enabling us to respond promptly to the latest market developments.

During the year, despite facing macroeconomic challenges and increasing credit risks, the Hong Kong banking system remained resilient, with ample capital and liquidity. At the end of 2022, the consolidated capital adequacy ratio of local banks was 20.1%, far above the international minimum requirement of 8%. In the fourth quarter of 2022, the liquidity coverage ratio of large banks rose slightly to 162.3%, also well above the statutory minimum requirement of 100%. Given the challenges in the credit environment, the asset quality of the banking system slightly deteriorated, with the specific classified loan ratio rising to 1.38% at the end of 2022. However, this level remained stable and was below the long-term average of 1.8% since 2000.

# Banking system: effective supervision ensures stable operation.

The pandemic has persisted for three years, and challenges from various fronts have intensified, such as rising geopolitical tensions and the tightening of monetary policy by major central banks. However, thanks to prudent risk management and effective supervision over the years, the banking system in Hong Kong has remained resilient and continues to play a vital role in supporting the economy.

Over the past year, a major regulatory challenge has been maintaining sound credit risk management while ensuring banks continue to provide the necessary support to their customers in the face of ongoing economic uncertainty following the fifth wave of COVID-19. The "pre-approved principal and interest moratorium" scheme has been further extended, and a voluntary partial principal repayment option has been added, allowing borrowers to choose to begin repaying part of their principal to help customers prepare for the eventual resumption of normal repayments.

In response to significant tightening of monetary policies by major economies leading to increased market volatility, another key regulatory task of the Financial Supervisory Service in 2022 is to strengthen the monitoring of banks’ market and liquidity risk bearing. We have thoroughly assessed the potential impact of synchronized monetary policy tightening across various economies on banks and introduced new scenarios for stress testing to evaluate banks’ resilience to prolonged liquidity stress.

At the same time, we continue to take proactive measures to promote effective risk management across multiple areas. In terms of operational resilience and cybersecurity capabilities, we provide guidance to help banks establish comprehensive operational frameworks to achieve stable operations. We also provide detailed regulatory guidance for specific operational areas, including guidance on cloud computing in response to the widespread adoption of cloud technology. Additionally, in response to the accelerated development of digitalization, we have strengthened our efforts to combat phishing scams and promote consumer and investor protection.

In addition to maintaining the stability of the banking system, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is also committed to promoting financial inclusion and enhancing the convenience of banking services. Banks have responded positively to the HKMA's call to provide basic banking services, with some establishing branches and self-service banking facilities in large public housing estates in newly developed areas. Affected by pandemic-related travel restrictions, many Hong Kong residents have been unable to access their mainland China bank accounts. In response, the HKMA has closely collaborated with relevant parties to help reactivate approximately 500,000 mainland China bank accounts, allowing affected account holders to do so without needing to travel to mainland China in person.

Another area of strategic importance for the continued development of the banking industry is enhancing professional capabilities. To expand their businesses, banks still have a substantial demand for professional talent. Based on its talent development strategy — "Connecting Talent with the Future" — the Financial Supervisory Commission has launched several measures over the past year to help the banking industry attract, nurture, and retain talent, focusing on upgrading and retraining the skills of existing employees, as well as cultivating the younger generation to build a sustainable talent pool.

# International financial center: Hong Kong returns to the international stage!

The pandemic-related travel restrictions, which had been in place for some time, were gradually lifted in 2022, and we made extensive efforts to restore Hong Kong’s position on the international stage. The "International Financial Leaders Investment Summit" held in November attracted over 200 international and regional leaders from global financial institutions to Hong Kong, garnering widespread attention and enthusiastic responses worldwide. Despite the summit coinciding with the first No. 8 typhoon signal issued in November in 50 years, the event was a resounding success, conveying a strong message to the world that Hong Kong has fully recovered and is demonstrating unprecedented vitality. We are pleased to see the summit has generated a positive ripple effect, with many global financial institutions and international organizations currently hosting or planning to host various events in Hong Kong.

In addition to attracting visitors from around the world to return to Hong Kong, my colleagues and I at the Hong Kong Monetary Authority have come to appreciate the importance of face-to-face communication and engagement. Therefore, we make every effort to personally represent Hong Kong at major international conferences, actively participate in global policy discussions, and use overseas visits to meet with senior management of global financial institutions, deepening their understanding of Hong Kong’s robust financial system and the various opportunities offered by Hong Kong under “one country, two systems.”

To ensure Hong Kong maintains its competitiveness as an international financial center, we are continuously exploring new markets in strategic focus areas such as financial technology, mainland opportunities, and green and sustainable finance. We are also further strengthening Hong Kong’s financial platform to provide top-tier services and attract more businesses to establish in Hong Kong. For details on the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s work in green and sustainable finance, please refer to the “2022 Sustainable Development Report.”

# FinTech

Following the announcement of the "FinTech 2025 Strategy" in June 2021, we achieved significant progress in five key areas in 2022.

We have achieved ideal results in our work on "comprehensive digitalization of banking." According to the results of the fintech application assessment, the Hong Kong banking industry has widely adopted fintech across various business areas, and the categories of technology adopted continue to increase. Our efforts to gradually promote and support digitalization since 2017 have received active responses from banks and continue to yield encouraging outcomes. We will continue to closely collaborate with the industry, based on the assessment results, to further promote the application of fintech in specific banking business areas and foster the development of individual technology categories.

This year, we have made significant progress in our work on central bank digital currency. The "mBridge" project, which aims to establish a multi-central bank digital currency cross-border network, has entered the trial phase and has become one of the first central bank digital currency projects globally to conduct real settlements for cross-border corporate transactions. On the retail level, the technical testing for cross-border usage of digital renminbi has entered the second phase, primarily testing the ability to top up digital renminbi wallets through "Overseas Remittance Express." Regarding digital Hong Kong dollars, we will adopt a three-track approach to prepare for the potential issuance of digital Hong Kong dollars in the future, and we will launch the second track pilot program, inviting the industry to explore feasible application scenarios for digital Hong Kong dollars in depth.

Data can fully unlock the potential of financial technology. Our "Business Data Link," launched in October last year, is an important step toward enhancing Hong Kong's data infrastructure. As a data-sharing infrastructure based on authorization from data owners, "Business Data Link" enables financial institutions to access business data of companies, making it easier for companies, especially small and medium-sized enterprises, to obtain financing. As of the end of 2022, "Business Data Link" had facilitated over 1,000 SME loans, totaling more than HKD 1.9 billion.

Finally, while we embrace financial innovation and its benefits, we also recognize the necessity to monitor and properly address the risks that may arise from such developments. We are closely watching the development in the virtual asset sector and participating in international discussions on related regulatory matters. After considering public consultations and relevant international standards, we will adopt the principle of "same risk, same regulation" to establish a regulatory framework for stablecoins and define their regulatory scope. In the future, the stablecoins we will regulate first will be those that claim to be pegged to the value of one or more fiat currencies, as these types of stablecoins may pose higher and more urgent potential risks to monetary and financial stability. We believe that under appropriate regulations, the industry will be able to more safely and securely explore the potential of digital finance.

Technology is reshaping our future. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the banking industry are actively preparing for this "new normal." We are confident that the fintech ecosystem we are building will help fully unlock the potential of fintech and enhance Hong Kong’s competitiveness as an international financial center.

# Opportunities in Mainland China

# 2022年摘要

# 經濟及金融環境

受第五波新冠病毒疫情、金融狀況收緊及充滿挑戰的外圍環境等多項不利因素的影響，香港經濟在2022年顯著收縮。勞工市場首先轉差，其後逐步改善，而通脹則維持溫和。受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預計2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。

香港銀行體系在2022年繼續保持穩健，資本及流動性狀況維持充裕，資產質素繼續處於健康水平。

# 貨幣穩定

隨着美國收緊貨幣政策，港元轉弱，弱方兌換保證於年內被多次觸發。然而，港元外匯及貨幣市場繼續保持有序及暢順運作，一再證明聯繫匯率制度穩健有效。

# 儲備管理

2022年的投資環境異常動盪，多種資產類別的價格同時下挫，外匯基金錄得整體投資回報率為負4.5%，與市場上大部分多元資產基金的表現相比，虧損幅度相對溫和。

金管局亦繼續致力推動負責任投資及資產多元化。與此同時，長期增長組合自2009年開展投資以來的內部回報率年率為12.6%。

# 銀行體系穩定

面對金融市場波動擴大，金管局加強對銀行的信用及市場風險管理的監管，並與銀行緊密合作，提升銀行的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力，以應對網絡威脅持續增加及銀行業數碼轉型步伐加快的情況。

金管局進一步推出有關「先買後付」產品及新增物業轉按支付安排的消費者保障措施。此外，金管局與其他監管機構合作制定虛擬資產監管架構，並就分銷投資產品發出指引及推出全新的信託業務監管制度。有關個人信貸資料的「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」亦於年內啟用。

金管局繼續與銀行合作提升香港的打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統，並加強對騙案的回應措施，又透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」系列進一步推動數據與科技的應用，以及加快金管局就反洗錢工作採用監管科技的步伐。

金管局在本地實施有關資本充足標準及披露標準等國際監管標準方面取得良好進展。金管局亦與銀行業共同為未來發展努力建立可持續的人才庫及提升從業員的技能。

為確保香港備有具公信力的處置機制，金管局制定新處置標準，又進行地區危機模擬演習，並在所有具本地系統重要性銀行建立一層新的吸收虧損能力資源，為處置機制的發展立下重要的里程碑。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

「國際金融領袖投資峰會」取得成功，鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，並製造正面的漣漪效應。

中國人民銀行與金管局之間的貨幣互換協議於年內優化，進一步鞏固香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。金管局亦與其他監管機構及持份者合作，籌備開通「互換通」，及推出配合人民幣計價股票在港交易的雙櫃台莊家機制。另又致力發展債務工具中央結算系統成為亞洲區主要的國際中央證券託管平台。

在加強香港金融平台的競爭力方面取得良好進展，涵蓋債券發行、資產及財富管理、企業財資中心，以及綠色和可持續金融等範疇。

金管局亦繼續推行「金融科技2025」策略，促進金融業界採用金融科技，並提升香港作為金融科技樞紐的地位。快速支付系統「轉數快」隨着功能提升，使用量穩步增長。

# 機構職能

金管局透過不同渠道與社會及市場保持有效聯繫，提升公眾對金管局政策及工作的了解。

對內，金管局悉心建立一支強調靈活應變及可持續發展的工作團隊，同時遵守嚴格的財政紀律及提升資訊科技能力，應對變化及確保有效執行各項政策及措施。

# 2022 Summary

# Economic and financial environment

Hong Kong's economy significantly contracted in 2022, affected by multiple adverse factors including the fifth wave of the novel coronavirus pandemic, tightened financial conditions, and a challenging external environment. The labor market initially deteriorated before gradually improving, while inflation remained moderate. Benefiting from the full resumption of cross-border travel between mainland China and Hong Kong, Hong Kong's economic growth is expected to recover from a low base in 2023.

The Hong Kong banking system remained resilient in 2022, with ample capital and liquidity, and the quality of assets continued to be at a healthy level.

# Currency Stability

As the United States tightened its monetary policy, the Hong Kong dollar weakened, and the weak-side exchange guarantee was triggered multiple times within the year. However, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and money markets continued to operate in an orderly and smooth manner, repeatedly demonstrating the robustness and effectiveness of the linked exchange rate system.

# Inventory Management

The investment environment in 2022 was exceptionally volatile, with prices across various asset classes declining simultaneously. The foreign exchange fund recorded an overall investment return of negative 4.5%, a relatively mild loss compared to the performance of most multi-asset funds in the market.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to strive to promote responsible investment and asset diversification. Meanwhile, the Long-Term Growth Fund has achieved an annualized internal rate of return of 12.6% since its investment commencement in 2009.

# The banking system is stable.

Facing increased volatility in financial markets, the Financial Supervisory Commission is strengthening its oversight of banks' credit and market risk management and working closely with banks to enhance their operational resilience and network defense capabilities, in response to the continued increase in cyber threats and the accelerated pace of digital transformation in the banking sector.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has further introduced consumer protection measures relating to "buy now, pay later" products and new arrangements for property mortgage refinancing payments. In addition, the HKMA has collaborated with other regulatory bodies to establish a regulatory framework for virtual assets, issued guidelines on the distribution of investment products, and launched a new trust business regulatory regime. The "Credit Information Platform" under the "Multiple Credit Information Service Providers" model concerning personal credit information has also been launched this year.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority continues to collaborate with banks to enhance Hong Kong’s anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing (AML) ecosystem, and strengthen measures to respond to fraud. It also further promotes the application of data and technology through the “Anti-Money Laundering Compliance Technology Laboratory” series, and accelerates the HKMA’s adoption of regtech in AML work.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has made good progress in implementing international regulatory standards relating to capital adequacy and disclosure standards locally. The HKMA is also working with the banking sector to build a sustainable talent pool and enhance the skills of practitioners for future development.

To ensure Hong Kong has credible resolution mechanisms, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority has formulated new resolution standards, conducted regional crisis simulation exercises, and established a new layer of loss-absorbing capacity resources at all banks of local systemic importance, marking an important milestone in the development of resolution mechanisms.

# Hong Kong's Status as an International Financial Center

The "International Financial Leaders' Investment Summit" achieved success, consolidating Hong Kong's position as an international financial center and creating positive ripple effects.

The currency swap agreement between the People's Bank of China and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority was enhanced during the year, further consolidating Hong Kong's position as a global offshore RMB business hub. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also collaborated with other regulators and stakeholders to prepare for the launch of "Swap Connect" and to introduce a dual-counter mechanism to support the trading of RMB-denominated stocks in Hong Kong. It is also committed to developing the Central Securities Settlement System for debt instruments into a major international central securities depository platform in Asia.

Significant progress has been made in enhancing the competitiveness of Hong Kong's financial platform, covering areas such as bond issuance, asset and wealth management, corporate treasury centers, as well as green and sustainable finance.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continues to implement the "FinTech 2025" strategy, promoting the adoption of FinTech by the financial industry and enhancing Hong Kong's position as a FinTech hub. The fast payment system "SpeedPay" has seen a steady increase in usage as its functionality improves.

# Organizational Functions

The Monetary Authority maintains effective communication with society and the market through various channels to enhance the public's understanding of its policies and work.

Internally, the Monetary Authority has diligently established a work team that emphasizes flexibility and sustainable development, while adhering to strict fiscal discipline and enhancing information technology capabilities to respond to changes and ensure the effective implementation of various policies and measures.

# 2022年大事紀要

# 貨幣穩定

# 5月26日

政府於「機構債券發行計劃」下以投標方式首次發行5億港元的20年期港元政府債券。

# 7月4日

中國人民銀行（人民銀行）與金管局公布優化貨幣互換協議，改為常備協議形式，毋須續期，協議規模並由原來的5,000億元人民幣╱5,900億元港幣擴大至8,000億元人民幣╱9,400億元港幣。

# 7月13日

金管局發出《全球外匯市場準則》的更新承諾聲明，藉以重申承諾在外匯市場以市場參與者身分行事時會遵守該準則的更新版本。

# 7月22日

金管局公布優化人民幣流動資金安排，包括擴大規模及簡化操作。

# 銀行體系

# 1月28日

金管局與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）發出聯合通函，就中介人從事虛擬資產相關活動提供更新指引以保障客戶。

# 1月28日

金管局就銀行管理與虛擬資產及虛擬資產服務提供者相關的洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險的監管指引作出更新。

# 2月8日

金管局宣布延長「銀行業人才起動計劃」6個月。

# 2月23日

香港按揭證券有限公司（按揭證券公司）全資擁有的香港按證保險有限公司（按證保險公司）宣布，按揭保險計劃就已落成住宅物業作出修訂及擴大適用範

# 2月23日

「百分百擔保個人特惠貸款計劃」推出優化措施（4月19日生效），並將申請期延長至2023年4月底。

# 2月23日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃6個月至10月底，貿易融資貸款本金還款期則可獲延長90天。計劃亦同時提供一個為期一年的部分本金還款選項，讓有意願和有能力的借款人逐步回復正常還款。

「中小企融資擔保計劃」亦推出優化措施（4月1日生效），並將申請期延長至2023年6月30日。

# 4月1日

金管局及保險業監管局（保監局）推出措施就利用保費融資投購人壽保單加強客戶保障。

# 4月14日

金管局就協助香港市民在因疫情而實施的檢疫限制下重新啟動其內地銀行帳戶，向香港銀行發出指引。

# 4月26日

金管局推出「合規科技資訊平台」，以鼓勵香港合規科技生態圈加強在應用合規科技方面的經驗及專門知識交流。

# 4月28日

金管局宣布與銀行業聯合推出「銀行業畢業生培訓計劃」，為銀行業的快速增長領域擴大人才庫。

# 5月5日

金管局認可由香港銀行公會（銀行公會）和接受存款公司公會將實施的「強制性背景查核計劃」，旨在處理香港銀行業中「滾動的壞蘋果」現象。

# 5月6日

「百分百擔保個人特惠貸款計劃」開始接受個別受暫緩追討欠租安排影響的業主申請，直至10月31日。

# 5月25日

金管局發表《零售銀行前線部門獎勵制度專題評估》的報告（英文版），以持續推動銀行業穩善文化。

# 5月27日

金管局發出《信託業務營運守則》及相關的《監管政策手冊》新單元，以加強規管與監管香港信託業務。

# 5月31日

按揭證券公司全資擁有的香港年金有限公司宣布，香港年金計劃推出優化措施及推廣優惠。優化措施包括提高「醫療和牙科開支特別款項提取」金額上限及個人保費總金額上限。

# 6月23日

金管局發布金融科技應用評估的結果及相關工作計劃，以進一步支持業界應用金融科技。

# 7月1日

為實施巴塞爾委員會的「銀行於基金的股權投資的資本要求」而制定的《2022年銀行業（資本）（修訂）規則》生效。

# 7月6至8日

金管局參與設計和執行為期3日的區域危機模擬演習。該演習共涉及10間亞太區的中央銀行、監管和處置當局以及存款保險機構，旨在加強跨境合作。

# 7月8日

金管局就認可機構銷售保障型投資相連壽險提供指引，為客戶提供保障。

# 7月8日

金管局根據政府發表的《2022年香港洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險評估報告》所概述的主要見解及相關影響，向銀行及儲值支付工具持牌人發出指引。

# 7月20日

金管局歡迎銀行公會公布就住宅物業轉按交易提供多一種支付安排予客戶選擇。按揭銀行於11月7日開始提供該項新增的物業交易支付安排。

# 7月21日

金管局與數碼港在德勤協助下，合辦第二次「反洗錢合規科技實驗室(AMLab 2)，主要聚焦門檻較低及容易落實的「易用科技」。

# 9月2日

金管局就銀行的「先買後付」產品推出一系列消費者保護措施，以推動負責任借貸。

# 9月8日

金管局宣布推出一站式網上資源平台「銀行業導航」及第二屆「銀行業銜接課程」。

# 9月16日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃3個月至2023年1月底。

同日，按證保險公司宣布，「中小企融資擔保計劃」下的還息不還本安排亦相應延長，借款企業可申請延遲償還本金合共最多36個月。

# 9月26日

金管局敲定「金融科技從業員培訓資助先導計劃」的實施細則，並正式在銀行業界啟動計劃。

# 9月27日

證監會與金管局發表有關持牌法團和註冊機構銷售非交易所買賣投資產品的第二次年度聯合調查結果，共有327間持牌法團及63間註冊機構呈報它們在2021年內銷售投資產品的相關數據，總交易額達50,150億港元，參與的投資者增加5%至770,000名。

# 9月27日

金管局在「銀行專業資歷架構」下推出「合規」單元，與銀行業界合作制定一套可供業界共同採用和具透明度的能力標準，以提升從事合規工作的從業員的專業能力。

# 10月6日

金管局聯同銀行公會、銀行及儲值支付工具業界支持香港警務處推出詐騙陷阱搜尋器「防騙視伏器」，以加強預防、偵測及制止社會上的詐騙行為及減少公眾的財務損失。

除了發出實務指引和更新相關的「常見問題」外，金管局亦與銀行及儲值支付工具業界合作，通過網頁及社交媒體上的消費者教育資訊，提高公眾的防騙意識，並發布《匯思》文章闡述這方面的工作。

# 10月20日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃6個月至2023年7月底，並優化部分本金還款選項，協助有能力的企業準備日後逐步回復正常還款。

按證保險公司亦宣布，「中小企融資擔保計劃」下還息不還本安排的申請期延長6個月至2023年6月底，上限則延長6個月至合共最多42個月。

# 10月21日

金管局發出兩份通告，以更新銷售及分銷彌補虧損產品的相關要求，及就合適性評估提供指引。

# 11月24日

金管局與數碼港合作，並由德勤協助，舉辦第三次「反洗錢合規科技實驗室(AMLab 3)。AMLab 3建基於過往AMLab系列的成果，運用網絡分析應對欺詐風險及減低傀儡戶口網絡騙案所造成的損失。

# 11月28日

在金管局的大力支持下，「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」開始運作，以提升香港個人信貸資料服務機構的服務水平，並減低現時因市場只有一間商業營運的服務提供者而衍生的營運風險。

# 12月7日

金管局就將於2023年6月生效的《2022年打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（修訂）條例草案》向銀行發出通告，闡明與銀行業相關的最新修訂。

# 12月15日

金管局為銀行及儲值支付工具業界舉辦打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）講座，內容涵蓋監管要求的更新、反洗錢監管科技和合規科技、財富來源的監管要求、可疑交易報告的反饋及打擊大規模毀滅武器擴散資金籌集風險的更新。

# 12月23日

金管局、保監局和強制性公積金計劃管理局聯合發布通函，概述3間監管機構首度聯合展開有關中介人銷售兩種可扣稅產品手法（即合資格延期年金保單和強制性公積金可扣稅自願性供款）的喬裝客戶檢查計劃的主要結果和從中觀察到的良好做法。

# 12月31日

所有香港的具本地系統重要性銀行已建立一層新的財務資源以備在處置時吸收虧損，標誌着金管局在提升這類銀行的處置可行性及銀行體系穩健性上立下里程碑。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

# 1月12日

金管局發布一份關於加密資產和穩定幣的討論文件，文件闡述了金管局就加密資產，尤其是用作支付用途的穩定幣的監管模式的構思，並邀請業界和公眾就有關的監管模式提出意見。

# 1月27日

金管局與瑞士聯邦財政部轄下的瑞士聯邦國際金融事務秘書處在線上合辦第五次香港與瑞士金融合作對話。

# 2月

金管局再次獲任命為財務行動特別組織轄下評估及合規小組聯席主席，任期兩年。財務行動特別組織是反洗錢全球標準制定組織。

# 2月11日

按揭證券公司宣布與14間合作銀行簽訂基建貸款合作框架《諒解備忘錄》，就基建貸款上的合作定立主要準則。

# 2月14日

金融學院轄下負責研究工作的香港貨幣及金融研究中心發表新一份題為《人口轉變及長期資產市場：香港的機遇及發展》的應用金融研究報告（英文版）。

# 3月8日

國際貨幣基金組織（基金組織）代表團就香港特別行政區2022年第四條磋商發表評估報告，再次肯定香港作為主要國際金融中心的地位，具備穩健強韌的金融體系、有效的宏觀經濟及審慎政策，以及健全的規管及監管框架，並認同香港金融業在疫情期間，依然持續擴張和發展。

基金組織亦讚揚香港在應對氣候變化方面取得重大進展，並認同政府努力不懈加強綠色和可持續金融生態圈。

# 3月30日

綠色和可持續金融跨機構督導小組公布對香港碳市場機遇的初步可行性評估。根據評估結果，督導小組公布支持香港發展成為區域碳交易中心的後續工作。

# 4月12日

香港貨幣及金融研究中心與金融學院合辦「宏觀經濟最新發展、美聯儲收緊貨幣政策及離岸人民幣市場的發展」線上研討會，吸引84萬人次在線參與。

# 4月27日

金管局發布題為《從政策及設計角度看「數碼港元」》的討論文件，闡述在香港引入零售層面央行數碼貨幣（即「數碼港元」或e-HKD）所涉及的主要政策及設計事項，並徵求意見。

# 5月3日

金管局和世界銀行集團成員國際金融公司共同發起的「綠色商業銀行聯盟」與渣打銀行於網上合辦「綠色及可持續資本市場蛻變圓桌會議」。

# Chronological Record of Major Events in 2022

# Currency Stability

# May 26th

The government issued for the first time HK$500 million 20-year Hong Kong dollar government bonds under the "Institutional Bond Issuance Program" through a bidding process.

# July 4th

The People's Bank of China (PBOC) and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) announced the optimization of their currency swap agreement, converting it into a standing agreement form that does not require renewal. The agreement's scale has been expanded from 5,000 billion yuan (5,900 billion Hong Kong dollars) to 8,000 billion yuan (9,400 billion Hong Kong dollars).

# July 13th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued an updated commitment statement regarding the Global Foreign Exchange Market Guidelines, reaffirming its commitment to comply with the updated version of the Guidelines when acting as a market participant in the foreign exchange market.

# July 22

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority announced the optimization of the RMB liquidity arrangement, including expanding the scale and simplifying operations.

# Banking system

# January 28th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) have issued a joint circular providing updated guidance to intermediaries engaging in virtual asset-related activities to protect clients.

# January 28th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has updated its regulatory guidelines on money laundering and terrorist financing risks associated with banks managing virtual assets and virtual asset service providers.

# February 8th

The Financial Supervisory Commission announced an extension of the “Banking Industry Talent Launch Program” by six months.

# February 23rd

Hong Kong Mortgage Insurance Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Hong Kong Mortgage Securities Limited (Mortgage Securities Company), announced revisions and an expanded scope for the mortgage insurance plan concerning completed residential properties.

# February 23rd

"100% Guaranteed Personal Preferential Loan Program" introduces enhanced measures (effective April 19) and extends the application period to the end of April 2023.

# February 23rd

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority, together with the "Small and Medium-sized Enterprises Loan Coordination Mechanism" in the Banking Sector, announced that the "Pre-approved Interest-only Repayment" scheme would be extended for six months until the end of October. The principal repayment period for trade finance loans can be extended by 90 days. The scheme also provides a one-year partial principal repayment option, allowing borrowers who are willing and able to gradually resume normal repayments.

The "SME Financing Guarantee Scheme" has also introduced enhancements (effective April 1) and extended the application period until June 30, 2023.

# April 1st

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Insurance Authority (Insurance Supervision Bureau) have introduced measures to enhance customer protection through the use of premium financing for purchasing life insurance policies.

# April 14th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued guidelines to Hong Kong banks regarding assisting Hong Kong residents in restarting their mainland bank accounts under quarantine restrictions implemented due to the pandemic.

# April 26

The HKMA launches the "Compliance Technology Information Platform" to encourage the Hong Kong compliance technology ecosystem to enhance the exchange of experience and expertise in applying compliance technology.

# April 28th

The Financial Supervisory Commission announced a joint launch of the "Banking Industry Graduate Training Program" with the banking sector to expand the talent pool for the industry’s rapidly growing areas.

# May 5th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has approved the “Compulsory Background Check Scheme” to be implemented by the Hong Kong Association of Banks (HKAB) and the Hong Kong Deposit-Taking Companies Association, which aims to address the phenomenon of “rolling bad apples” within the Hong Kong banking industry.

# May 6th

"100% Guaranteed Individual Special Loan Program" begins accepting applications from individual landlords affected by the temporary suspension of rent recovery arrangements, until October 31.

# May 25th

The Monetary Authority of Hong Kong released an English version of the report titled "Special Study on the Incentive System of Front-line Departments in Retail Banking" to continuously promote a sound banking culture.

# May 27th

The HKMA has issued new sections of the "Trust Business Operation Guidelines" and the related "Supervisory Policy Manual" to enhance the regulation and supervision of trust business in Hong Kong.

# May 31st

Mortgage Securities Company's wholly-owned Hong Kong Annuity Limited announced the introduction of enhanced measures and promotional offers for the Hong Kong Annuity Plan. The enhanced measures include increasing the upper limit of "medical and dental expense special withdrawal amounts" and the total individual premium amount limit.

# June 23rd

The Monetary Authority has released the results of its assessment of fintech applications and a related work plan to further support the industry’s adoption of fintech.

# July 1st

The 2022 Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules, formulated to implement the Basel Committee's "Capital Requirements for Banks' Equity Investments in Funds," came into effect.

# July 6th to 8th

The Monetary Authority participated in designing and conducting a three-day regional crisis simulation exercise. The exercise involved 10 central banks, regulatory and resolution authorities, and deposit insurance institutions from the Asia-Pacific region, aiming to strengthen cross-border cooperation.

# July 8th

The Monetary Authority provides guidance on the sale of guaranteed investment-linked life insurance by authorized institutions to offer protection to customers.

# July 8th

The HKMA issued guidance to banks and licensed value-added payment tool operators based on the main findings and related implications outlined in the Government's "2022 Hong Kong Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing Risk Assessment Report."

# July 20th

The Monetary Authority welcomes the Banking Association’s announcement of providing customers with an additional payment arrangement for mortgage transfer transactions. Participating banks will begin offering this new property transaction payment arrangement on November 7.

# July 21

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and Cyberport, with Deloitte’s assistance, jointly hosted the second “Anti-Money Laundering Compliance Technology Laboratory (AMLab 2),” focusing primarily on “user-friendly technology” with lower barriers to entry and easier implementation.

# September 2nd

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has launched a series of consumer protection measures for “buy now, pay later” products offered by banks, in order to promote responsible lending.

# September 8th

The Financial Services and Markets Commission announced the launch of an all-in-one online resource platform “[Banking Industry Navigator]” and the second session of the “Banking Industry Bridging Course.”

# September 16th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) announced in conjunction with the "SME Loan Coordination Mechanism in the Banking Sector" the extension of the "pre-approved interest-only repayment" plan by three months until the end of January 2023.

On the same day, according to the Insurance Authority, the principal repayment moratorium arrangement under the "SME Financing Guarantee Scheme" has also been extended accordingly, allowing borrowing enterprises to apply to defer principal repayment for a maximum of 36 months in total.

# September 26th

The Financial Supervisory Commission has finalized the implementation details of the "Financial Technology Practitioners Training Subsidy Pilot Program" and formally launched the program within the banking industry.

# September 27

The Securities and Futures Commission and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority jointly released the second annual joint survey results on the sale of non-OTC investment products by licensed corporations and registered institutions. A total of 327 licensed corporations and 63 registered institutions reported relevant data on their sales of investment products during 2021, with a total transaction value of HKD 501.5 billion. The number of investors participating increased by 5% to 770,000.

# September 27

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority introduced a "compliance" module under the "Banking Professional Qualifications Framework," collaborating with the banking industry to develop a set of common, transparent capability standards for industry adoption, aiming to enhance the professional competence of compliance practitioners.

# October 6th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority, together with the Hong Kong Bankers' Association, banks, and the stored value payment industry, supports the Hong Kong Police Force in launching the Anti-Fraud Vision Detector to enhance the prevention, detection, and suppression of fraudulent activities in society and reduce financial losses to the public.

In addition to issuing practical guidance and updating the relevant "Frequently Asked Questions," the HKMA has also collaborated with banks and the stored value payment tool industry to raise public awareness of fraud prevention through consumer education information on websites and social media, and has published articles in "HKMA Insights" to explain this work.

# October 20th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority, in collaboration with the "Coordination Mechanism for SME Loans in the Banking Sector", announced the extension of the "Pre-Approval Interest-Only Loan Scheme" by six months until July 31, 2023, and optimized some principal repayment options to assist capable enterprises in preparing to gradually resume normal repayments.

According to insurance companies, the application period for the "SME Financing Guarantee Scheme" with the principal repayment deferral arrangement has been extended by 6 months to the end of June 2023, and the maximum term has been extended by 6 months to a total of up to 42 months.

# October 21

The Monetary Authority issued two notices to update the relevant requirements for the sale and distribution of products designed to offset losses and to provide guidance on suitability assessments.

# November 24

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and Cyberport are collaborating, with the assistance of Deloitte, to host the third “Anti-Money Laundering Compliance Technology Laboratory (AMLab 3).” Building on the achievements of previous AMLab series, AMLab 3 utilizes network analysis to address fraud risks and reduce losses caused by scams involving dummy accounts.

# November 28

With the strong support of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, the "Credit Information Platform" under the "Multiple Credit Information Service Providers" model has begun operations, aiming to enhance the service level of credit information service providers in Hong Kong and reduce operational risks arising from the current situation where there is only one commercial operator in the market.

# December 7

The Monetary Authority will issue a notice to banks regarding the draft law "Ammendments to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (2022)" which will take effect in June 2023, clarifying the latest amendments relevant to the banking sector.

# December 15th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) organized a seminar for the banking and stored value payment instruments industry on combating money laundering and terrorist financing (AML), covering updates on regulatory requirements, AML regulatory technology and compliance technology, requirements for identifying the source of wealth, feedback on suspicious transaction reports, and updates on the risk of financing the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.

# December 23

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority, the Insurance Authority, and the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority jointly issued a circular outlining the main results of the first joint customer impersonation inspection plan conducted by the three regulators on the sales practices of intermediaries for two tax-deductible products (i.e., eligible deferred annuity policies and tax-deductible voluntary contributions to the Mandatory Provident Fund), as well as the good practices observed during the inspection.

# December 31

All Hong Kong's locally systemically important banks have established a new layer of financial resources to absorb losses during resolution, marking a milestone for the HKMA in enhancing the feasibility of resolution and the stability of the banking system.

# Hong Kong's Role as an International Financial Hub.

# January 12th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has issued a discussion paper on crypto assets and stablecoins. The paper outlines the HKMA's conceptual framework for the regulatory approach to crypto assets, particularly stablecoins used for payment purposes, and invites industry stakeholders and the public to provide comments on the proposed regulatory framework.

# January 27th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Secretariat for International Financial Affairs under the Swiss Federal Department of Finance jointly hosted the fifth Hong Kong-Swiss Financial Cooperation Dialogue online.

# February

The Monetary Authority has been reappointed as co-chair of the Evaluation and Compliance Group under the Financial Action Task Force for a two-year term. The Financial Action Task Force is a global standards-setting organization for anti-money laundering.

# February 11th

The Mortgage Securities Company announced the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on the infrastructure loan cooperation framework with 14 partner banks, establishing main guidelines for cooperation on infrastructure loans.

# February 14th

The Hong Kong Centre for Monetary and Financial Studies, which oversees research activities under the School of Finance, has published a new applied financial research report in English titled "Demographic Changes and Long-term Asset Markets: Opportunities and Development for Hong Kong."

# March 8th

The International Monetary Fund (IMF) delegation issued an assessment report on Hong Kong's 2022 Article IV consultation, once again affirming Hong Kong's status as a major international financial center. The report highlighted Hong Kong's robust and resilient financial system, effective macroeconomic and prudent policies, as well as a sound regulatory and supervisory framework. It also acknowledged the continued expansion and development of Hong Kong's financial sector during the pandemic.

The fund organization also praised Hong Kong’s significant progress in addressing climate change and recognized the government’s tireless efforts to strengthen the green and sustainable financial ecosystem.

# March 30th

The Inter-Agency Oversight Group on Green and Sustainable Finance published a preliminary feasibility assessment on the opportunities of Hong Kong's carbon market. Based on the assessment results, the oversight group announced subsequent work to support Hong Kong's development into a regional carbon trading center.

# April 12th

The Hong Kong Monetary and Financial Research Centre, in collaboration with the School of Finance, hosted an online seminar titled "Latest Developments in Macroeconomics, the Federal Reserve's Tightening Monetary Policy, and the Development of the Offshore Renminbi Market," which attracted 840,000 participants online.

# April 27

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has issued a discussion paper titled "From a Policy and Design Perspective: The Digital Hong Kong Dollar," outlining the main policy and design issues involved in introducing a central bank digital currency at the retail level in Hong Kong (i.e., the "Digital Hong Kong Dollar" or e-HKD), and is seeking public opinion.

# May 3

The Green Banking Alliance, initiated by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) and the World Bank Group member International Finance Corporation (IFC), co-hosted an online "Green and Sustainable Capital Market Transformation Roundtable Meeting" with Standard Chartered Bank.

zh:
# 2023年工作重點及前瞻

儘管香港經濟在2023 年初出現復甦跡象，但外圍環境仍然充滿挑戰及不確定性。近期美國和歐洲的銀行業受壓，個別美國本土銀行在2023 年3 月倒閉，對環球金融市場造成漣漪效應，而主要央行收緊貨幣政策，很有可能令2023 年全球經濟增長放緩甚或衰退。另一方面，地緣政治局勢緊張，以及去全球化的威脅持續，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。儘管如此，香港金融體系憑藉多年來所建立穩健的抗震能力及充裕的緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。

金管局非常重視保障貨幣及金融穩定。展望未來，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局會保持警惕，力求迅速辨識正浮現的風險，並靈活應對。與此同時，金管局會繼續把握機遇及創造政策空間，進一步提升香港作為主要國際金融中心的地位。面對充滿挑戰的投資環境，金管局在管理外匯基金時會繼續審慎投資，同時保持足夠靈活性，按需要採取防禦措施，並維持高流動性。

# 金融體系保持穩定健全

環球經濟前景仍受制於重大的不確定因素。金管局會密切注視最新發展，提高警覺，防範各種潛在風險，以維持金融體系穩定健全；這是關乎持續提供關鍵金融服務的先決條件，因此亦是維繫香港經濟正常運作的命脈。

# 對潛在風險保持警惕

在2023年，美國利率未來走勢的不確定性，以及在先進經濟體銀行體系出現的壓力，可能會對主要先進經濟體的增長前景帶來下行風險。此外，持續的地緣政治風險，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。然而，香港金融體系憑藉過去多年所建立的抗震能力及緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。金管局亦有能力、資源及決心維持香港貨幣及金融穩定。

金管局將繼續密切注視本地及外圍環境的風險與脆弱性，並會按需要採取適當措施維持香港的貨幣及金融體系穩定。金管局亦會研究對香港經濟有影響的事項，以及評估與這些事項相關的潛在風險。

# 保持銀行體系穩定

鑑於地緣政治緊張局勢升級，以及各主要央行大幅加息以遏抑通脹，預計2023年銀行業的經營環境仍然充滿挑戰。另一方面，科技發展迅速及數碼化對銀行業來說既有危又有機。面對瞬息萬變的金融環境，金管局致力透過持續的監管工作確保銀行具足夠能力抵禦衝擊。與此同時，金管局亦會參照國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 風險為本的監管重點

# 信用、流動性及市場風險

在2023年，金管局將繼續密切注視認可機構的資產質素，並聚焦於認可機構的貸款分類及撥備做法，以及對財務狀況較差的借款人的管理。金管局亦會加強其監察系統，並採取積極措施確保銀行體系的整體信用風險水平維持可控。

另一方面，金管局會繼續留意企業的營運環境，並與銀行業及商界保持緊密溝通，以就最終退出「預先批核還息不還本」計劃作好準備，並同時確保暫時面對困難的客戶仍然得到適切的信貸支援。

此外，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局於2023年亦會加強監管認可機構的流動性及市場風險管理。

# 業務操作及科技風險

隨着銀行在業務營運中更廣泛應用科技，金管局會致力提升銀行業的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力。繼5月發出《監管政策手冊》新單元「運作穩健性」後，金管局會與業界保持緊密聯繫，審視認可機構在制定運作穩健性框架方面的進度。同時，金管局將透過跟進認可機構在「網絡防衛評估框架2.0」評估下發現的問題以及檢視認可機構實施穩固三重數據備份的進展，提高銀行業的網絡防衛能力。

隨着數碼化的步伐加快，金管局的其他監管重點包括加強對銀行的第三方服務供應商風險管理的監管，以及提升銀行業的數據管治能力。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集

在2023年，金管局的工作重點包括更新監管資訊、加強打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統各持份者的合作以應對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（洗錢）風險，以及進一步推動反洗錢監管科技與合規科技的發展。金管局的《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集指引》亦會作出修訂，並會就「政治人物」採取與風險相稱的措施發出具體指引，從而促進業界以有效及風險為本的方法落實法例的主要修訂。與此同時，金管局會擴大現有公私營夥伴合作的涵蓋範圍以加強訊息共享，以及支持推出銀行之間的訊息共享平台，藉以加快偵測可疑戶口及防範戶口被濫用，並加強對騙案受害人的保障和協助受害人追討損失。金管局亦會透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」及其他反洗錢合規科技項目，進一步集中推動採用合規科技（包括數據分析），並致力發展宏觀分析能力，以配合其數據為本的反洗錢監管工作。透過實施上述各項措施，金管局將能更迅速針對傀儡戶口網絡等系統性洗錢風險採取相應措施，以及靈活應對不斷轉變的威脅。

# 財富管理業務

金管局在2023年會加強有關認可機構在財富管理以及銷售證券、強制性公積金（強積金）與其他投資及保險產品方面的操守的現場審查及非現場監察。2023年的重點將會是「跨境理財通」計劃、數碼分銷及諮詢平台、虛擬資產、環境、社會及管治(ESG)投資產品及長期保險產品。金管局在有關過程中會參考市場最新發展及國際標準的修訂。

金管局亦會與其他監管機構及銀行界緊密聯繫，並按需要就銷售投資、保險及強積金產品的監管標準向認可機構提供指引，其中亦會包括有關提供虛擬資產相關投資服務的指引。就此而言，為促進虛擬資產行業可持續及負責任地發展，金管局會積極參與相關國際組織，並與政府及其他金融監管機構合作，制定全面的虛擬資產監管架構。

隨着「跨境理財通」順利推出，金管局會與業界及相關監管機構聯繫，以優化該計劃。此外，金管局亦會與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）及業界合作，精簡投資產品銷售程序（包括適用於資深投資者的銷售程序），以及開始根據相關《監管政策手冊》新單元及新營運守則監管認可機構的信託業務。

# 監察金融市場基建

金管局的目標是按照《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）、《金融市場基建的原則》（《基建原則》），以及支付及金融基建委員會發出的各項指引促進其所監察的金融市場基建的安全及效率，按需要參照最新的國際標準評估各項基建。金管局會參與支付及金融基建委員會與國際證監會組織對實施《基建原則》的監察及評估計劃，亦會參與國際標準制定組織的工作，並參照國際慣例或因應市場及科技發展加強本身的監察規定。同時，如有需要，金管局會與有關當局合作，進一步加強合作監察安排。

# 制定政策

金管局會因應國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 在香港實施巴塞爾標準

# 資本標準

金管局會透過實施巴塞爾銀行監管委員會（巴塞爾委員會）近年發布的標準，進一步優化資本框架，當中包括：
- 2017年12月《巴塞爾協定三：危機後改革的最終方案》、2019年1月（2019年2月修訂）《市場風險最低資本規定》，以及2020年7月《信用估值調整風險架構具針對性的修訂》所載的經修訂資本標準 — 上述經修訂資本標準統稱《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案，載明信用風險、市場風險、信用估值調整風險及業務操作風險的新監管處理方法，並引入出項下限規定，以及優化槓桿比率框架。經過2022年的多輪業界諮詢後，金管局計劃在2023年就《銀行業（資本）規則》（《資本規則》）的建議修訂進行法定諮詢，以實施上述各項規定及正值中性逆周期緩衝資本。有關修訂預計於同年內提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序，並不早於2024年1月1日生效，作為最低要求。
- 2022年12月《加密資產風險承擔的審慎處理方法》金管局計劃按照巴塞爾委員會的時間表，在2025年1月1日於本地實施有關標準，並打算於2023年就相關建議諮詢業界。

# 風險承擔限度

金管局於2023年3月就《銀行業（風險承擔限度）規則》的建議修訂諮詢業界。有關建議修訂主要是因應金管局實施上文提及的《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案下的經修訂資本標準而提出。諮詢文件亦包括就《資本規則》下有關官方實體集中風險的處理方法所作出的其他相應修訂。經修訂規則的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 流動性標準

金管局擬於2023年諮詢業界有關透過《2023年銀行業（流動性）（修訂）規則》（《2023年流動性修訂規則》）對《銀行業（流動性）規則》作出的建議修訂。相關修訂是因應同時期的《資本規則》建議修訂而作出，所以《2023年流動性修訂規則》的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 披露標準

《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案中與經修訂資本標準相關的新的及經修訂的披露規定，主要載於巴塞爾委員會分別於2018年12月及2021年11月發出的《第三支柱1 披露規定 — 更新框架》及《修訂市場風險披露規定》。巴塞爾委員會亦於2019年6月發出《修訂槓桿比率披露規定》，藉修訂槓桿比率的披露規定處理對潛在「粉飾櫥窗」（指銀行在報告日期前後減少某些交易的交易量，從而人為地提高報告及公開披露的槓桿比率）的關注。為在香港實施上述新的及經修訂的披露規定，金管局亦正擬備《銀行業（披露）規則》（《披露規則》）的相應修訂，以及經修訂後的標準披露模版及表格，並在過程中徵詢業界意見。預計《披露規則》的修訂將於2023年內連同《資本規則》的修訂一併提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序。

en:
# 2023 Work Priorities and Prospects

Despite signs of economic recovery in Hong Kong at the beginning of 2023, the external environment remains fraught with challenges and uncertainties. Recent pressures on the banking sectors in the United States and Europe, including the failure of several US banks in March 2023, have created ripple effects in global financial markets. The tightening of monetary policy by major central banks could likely slow global economic growth in 2023 or even trigger a recession. Simultaneously, heightened geopolitical tensions and the ongoing threat of deglobalization may continue to weigh on global trade and cause volatility in global financial markets. Nevertheless, Hong Kong’s financial system, underpinned by the robust resilience and ample buffers built up over the years, is well-equipped to withstand adverse shocks.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority places great emphasis on ensuring monetary and financial stability. Looking ahead, facing an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will remain vigilant, striving to quickly identify emerging risks and respond flexibly. At the same time, the HKMA will continue to seize opportunities and create policy space to further enhance Hong Kong's position as a major international financial center. Facing a challenging investment environment, the HKMA will continue to invest prudently in managing the foreign exchange fund, while maintaining sufficient flexibility, taking defensive measures as needed, and maintaining high liquidity.

# The financial system remains stable and sound.

The global economic outlook remains subject to significant uncertainties. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority will closely monitor the latest developments, remain vigilant, and guard against various potential risks to maintain the stability and soundness of the financial system; this is a prerequisite for continuously providing essential financial services, and therefore the lifeline for sustaining Hong Kong’s normal economic operation.

# Remain vigilant about potential risks.

In 2023, the uncertainty surrounding the future trajectory of US interest rates, as well as pressures emerging within the banking systems of advanced economies, may pose downside risks to the growth prospects of major advanced economies. Furthermore, persistent geopolitical risks may continue to weigh on global trade and cause volatility in global financial markets. However, Hong Kong’s financial system, bolstered by the resilience and buffers built up over past years, has ample capacity to withstand adverse shocks. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority also has the ability, resources, and determination to maintain the stability of Hong Kong’s currency and financial system.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority will continue to closely monitor the risks and vulnerabilities in the local and external environments, and will take appropriate measures as necessary to maintain the stability of Hong Kong’s monetary and financial systems. The HKMA will also study matters that affect the Hong Kong economy, and assess the potential risks associated with these matters.

# Maintain the stability of the banking system

Given the escalating geopolitical tensions and significant interest rate hikes by major central banks to curb inflation, the operating environment for the banking sector is expected to remain challenging in 2023. On the other hand, rapid technological development and digitalization present both risks and opportunities for the banking sector. Facing the rapidly changing financial landscape, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is committed to ensuring banks have sufficient capacity to withstand shocks through continuous regulatory efforts. At the same time, the HKMA will continue to strengthen and optimize the banking regulatory framework and policies by referring to international standards and best practices.

# Risk-Based Supervisory Priorities

# Credit, liquidity, and market risk

In 2023, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will continue to closely monitor the asset quality of authorized institutions, focusing on their loan classification and provisioning practices, as well as the management of borrowers in weaker financial standing. The HKMA will also strengthen its supervisory system and take proactive measures to ensure that the overall credit risk level of the banking system remains under control.

On the other hand, the Monetary Authority will continue to monitor the operating environment of enterprises, and maintain close communication with the banking sector and the business community in preparation for the eventual withdrawal from the "pre-approved interest-only repayment" scheme, while at the same time ensuring that customers facing temporary difficulties still receive appropriate credit support.

In addition, facing an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the Monetary Authority will also strengthen the supervision of liquidity and market risk management for authorized institutions in 2023.

# Business Operations and Technology Risk

As banks increasingly adopt technology in their business operations, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will strive to enhance the operational resilience and cybersecurity capabilities of the banking sector. Following the issuance of a new chapter on “Operational Resilience” in the Regulatory Policy Manual in May, the HKMA will maintain close communication with the industry to review the progress of authorized institutions in developing their operational resilience frameworks. Meanwhile, the HKMA will enhance the banking sector’s cybersecurity capabilities by following up on issues identified in the “Cybersecurity Assessment Framework 2.0” assessment and reviewing the progress of authorized institutions in implementing robust triple data backups.

As the pace of digitalization accelerates, the Monetary Authority's other regulatory priorities include strengthening the regulation of risk management for third-party service providers of banks, as well as enhancing the data governance capabilities of the banking sector.

# Combating Money Laundering and the Financing of Terrorism

In 2023, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) key priorities include updating regulatory information, strengthening collaboration among stakeholders in the anti-money laundering (AML) ecosystem to address money laundering and terrorist financing risks, and further promoting the development of AML regulatory technology and compliance technology. The HKMA's "Guidelines on Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing" will also be revised, providing specific guidance on implementing risk-proportionate measures for "political figures," thereby encouraging the industry to adopt effective and risk-based approaches to implement major legislative amendments. At the same time, the HKMA will expand the scope of existing public-private partnerships to enhance information sharing and support the launch of an inter-bank information sharing platform, aiming to accelerate the detection of suspicious accounts, prevent account abuse, and strengthen protection for victims of scams and assist them in recovering losses. The HKMA will also further focus on promoting the adoption of compliance technology, including data analytics, through the "AML Compliance Technology Laboratory" and other AML compliance technology initiatives, and strive to develop macro-level analytical capabilities to support its data-driven AML regulatory work. By implementing these measures, the HKMA will be able to respond more swiftly to systemic money laundering risks such as puppet account networks and flexibly address evolving threats.

# Wealth management services

The HKMA will strengthen on-site inspections and off-site monitoring of authorized institutions regarding their conduct in wealth management, the sale of securities, Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF), and other investment and insurance products in 2023. The key focus areas for 2023 will be the "Cross-border Wealth Management Connect" program, digital distribution and advisory platforms, virtual assets, Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) investment products, and long-term insurance products. The HKMA will refer to market developments and revised international standards during the process.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will also maintain close communication with other regulatory bodies and the banking sector, and provide guidance to authorized institutions on regulatory standards for the sale of investment, insurance, and mandatory provident fund products, which will also include guidance on providing investment services related to virtual assets. In this regard, to promote the sustainable and responsible development of the virtual asset industry, the HKMA will actively participate in relevant international organizations and collaborate with the government and other financial regulators to establish a comprehensive regulatory framework for virtual assets.

With the successful launch of the "Cross-Border Wealth Management Link," the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) will liaise with the industry and relevant regulatory authorities to optimize the program. Additionally, the HKMA will collaborate with the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) and the industry to streamline the sales procedures for investment products (including those applicable to sophisticated investors), as well as begin regulating the trust businesses of authorized institutions according to the new units and operational guidelines in the relevant Regulatory Policy Manual.

# Supervise Financial Market Infrastructure

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) aims to promote the safety and efficiency of financial market infrastructures under its supervision in accordance with the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Payment Ordinance), the Principles for Financial Market Infrastructures (Infrastructure Principles), and the guidelines issued by the Payment and Financial Market Infrastructure Committee. The HKMA will assess various infrastructures against the latest international standards as needed. It will participate in the monitoring and evaluation programs conducted by the Payment and Financial Market Infrastructure Committee in collaboration with the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) regarding the implementation of the Infrastructure Principles. The HKMA will also engage in the work of international standard-setting organizations and enhance its regulatory requirements in line with international practices or in response to market and technological developments. Meanwhile, if necessary, the HKMA will cooperate with relevant authorities to further strengthen cooperative supervision arrangements.

# Formulate policy

The Monetary Authority will continue to strengthen and optimize the banking regulatory framework and policies in accordance with international standards and best practices.

# Implementing Basel Standards in Hong Kong

# Capital Standard

The Financial Supervisory Commission will further optimize the capital framework by implementing standards recently published by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (Basel Committee), including:
- The revised capital standards set forth in the “Basel III: Final Basel III Reform” published in December 2017, the “Minimum Capital Requirements for Market Risk” (as amended in February 2019) published in January 2019, and the “Targeted Revisions to the Credit Valuation Adjustment Risk Framework” published in July 2020 — collectively referred to as the final Basel III reform package, which outlines new regulatory treatments for credit risk, market risk, credit valuation adjustment risk, and operational risk, and introduces a leverage ratio framework, as well as optimizes the capital ratio framework. Following multiple rounds of industry consultation in 2022, the Commission plans to conduct statutory consultation on the proposed amendments to the “Banking Sector (Capital) rules” (“Capital rules”) in 2023 to implement the aforementioned provisions and the countercyclical capital buffer. These amendments are expected to be submitted to the Legislative Council for prior enactment review within the same year and will take effect no earlier than January 1, 2024, as a minimum requirement.
- “Prudential Treatment of Crypto-Asset Risk Exposure” published in December 2022. The Commission plans to implement these standards locally on January 1, 2025, in accordance with the Basel Committee’s timeline, and intends to consult the industry on the related proposals in 2023.

# Risk tolerance limit

The Financial Supervisory Commission consulted with the industry in March 2023 regarding proposed amendments to the rules on the banking sector’s risk-bearing limits. These proposed amendments were primarily in response to the revised capital standards implemented by the Financial Supervisory Commission under the final reform package of the Basel III. The consultation document also included other related amendments to the handling of concentrated credit risk for official entities under the capital rules. The target implementation date for the revised rules will align with the implementation date of the revised credit risk portion of the capital rules under the final reform package of Basel III (no earlier than January 1, 2024).

# Liquidity Standard

The HKMA plans to consult the industry in 2023 regarding proposed amendments to the Rules on Banking Supervision (Liquidity) through the Banking (Liquidity) (Amendment) Rules 2023 (the “2023 Liquidity Amendment Rules”). These amendments are made in response to the proposed amendments to the Capital Rules at the same time, so the target implementation date of the 2023 Liquidity Amendment Rules will be consistent with the implementation date of the credit risk portion of the revised Capital Rules implementing the final reforms of the Basel III accords (i.e., no earlier than January 1, 2024).

# Disclosure Standards

The new and revised disclosure requirements related to the revised capital standards in the final reforms of Basel III are primarily set out in the Basel Committee's documents issued in December 2018 and November 2021, namely *Third Pillar 1 Disclosure Requirements – Updated Framework* and *Revised Market Risk Disclosure Requirements*. The Basel Committee also issued *Revised Leverage Ratio Disclosure Requirements* in June 2019 to address concerns about potential “window dressing” (referring to banks reducing certain transaction volumes before or after the reporting date to artificially inflate reported and publicly disclosed leverage ratios). To implement these new and revised disclosure requirements in Hong Kong, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is also preparing corresponding amendments to the Banking Sector (Disclosure) Rules (the “Disclosure Rules”), as well as revised standard disclosure templates and forms, while seeking industry feedback throughout the process. The revised Disclosure Rules are expected to be submitted to the Legislative Council for affirmative procedure alongside the revised Capital Rules within 2023.

zh:
# 機構管治

金管局作為香港的中央銀行機構，深明良好的管治對維持及維護公眾對金管局履行其法定職責的信任及信心的重要性，因此一直致力秉持高水平的機構管治。

為實踐良好機構管治的承諾，金管局：
- 建立了一套清晰且具備高問責性的機構管治架構；
- 實施完善穩健的監控措施以管理風險，並確保所有職級員工的行為及其日常運作均符合指定標準；及
- 奉行具透明度及保持開放的政策，與各持份者保持緊密聯繫。

# 金管局與香港特別行政區政府

金管局是香港特別行政區政府（特區政府）架構的一部分，但可以按與公務員不同的聘用條款聘請員工，以吸引具適當經驗與專門知識的人才。金管局總裁及其員工均為公職人員。金管局的日常運作，在金融管理專員所獲賦予或轉授的法定權力範圍內高度自主。

財政司司長負責釐定香港的貨幣政策目標及貨幣體制：財政司司長於2003年6月25日致金融管理專員的函件中，訂明應透過貨幣發行局制度維持貨幣穩定，將港元匯率保持在約7.80港元兌1美元的水平。金融管理專員須自行負責達成貨幣政策目標，包括決定有關的策略、工具及執行方式，並負責維持香港貨幣制度的穩定與健全。

財政司司長在財經事務及庫務局局長的協助下，負責維持香港金融體系穩定與健全，以及保持香港的國際金融中心地位的政策。為推行這些政策，金融管理專員的職責包括：
- 促進銀行體系的整體穩定與有效運作；
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，發展債務市場；
- 處理與法定紙幣及硬幣的發行及流通有關的事宜；
- 透過發展支付、結算及交收系統，以及在適當情況下負責操作有關系統，促進金融基建的安全與效率；及
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，促進對香港貨幣及金融體系的信心，並推行適當的發展市場措施，以協助加強香港金融服務的國際競爭力。

外匯基金由財政司司長掌有控制權。金融管理專員須根據財政司司長轉授的權力，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 問責性與透明度

就日常運作及推行政府政策目標所採用的方法，金管局一直保持高度自主，並同時輔以高問責性及透明度。

金管局致力促進貨幣與銀行體系穩定，有效管理官方儲備，發展與監察穩健及多元化的金融基建，從而鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，推動香港經濟發展。

金管局要有效履行職責，便必須取得社會人士的信任。因此，金管局以嚴謹的態度，履行向公眾解釋其政策及工作的責任，並盡力處理備受社會關注而涉及金管局職責範圍的事項。尤其，金管局透過傳統及社交媒體適時澄清有關金管局政策的失實資訊及謠言。

金融管理專員由財政司司長委任，因此金管局透過財政司司長向公眾負責；而由於金管局的職權由立法會通過的法律制訂，因此金管局亦透過立法會向公眾負責。金管局亦明白本身肩負更廣泛的責任，就是促進公眾對金管局角色及目標的認識，並密切留意社會人士所關注的事項。金管局在執行日常工作及與社會保持廣泛聯繫時，堅守盡力提高透明度及保持開放的政策。這項政策有兩大目標：
- 在顧及市場敏感性、商業秘密及機密資料披露的法定限制下，盡量使金融界及公眾充分了解金管局的工作；及
- 確保金管局掌握社會脈搏，並對公眾意見作出適當回應。

金管局在透明度方面致力達致國際最高標準，與傳媒保持廣泛聯繫之餘，亦出版各種中英文期刊及專題刊物。金管局的雙語網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)除有專門環節列載經濟研究、統計資料、監管資源、消費者資訊及其他課題外，還載有大量金管局出版的刊物、新聞稿、演辭及簡報會資料文件。此外，金管局又利用社交媒體平台，以能在數碼時代中更有效與公眾溝通。金管局辦事處設有資訊中心，分為圖書館及展覽館兩部分，每星期開放6日予公眾參觀及使用。有關金管局與公眾溝通及聯繫的工作，詳見「機構職能」一章（第157至162頁）。

金管局公布外匯基金及貨幣發行局帳目資料的次數，一直逐步增加，內容亦越趨詳細。金管局於1999年開始參與國際貨幣基金組織的中央銀行「數據公布特殊標準」計劃。金管局亦公布外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄，以及貨幣發行局制度運作報告。自1996年起，金管局網站載有銀行業監管政策及指引。

金管局與立法會的關係對提高問責性及透明度非常重要。金管局總裁承諾每年3次向立法會財經事務委員會簡報金管局各項工作及政策，並回答有關查詢。此外，金管局代表不時出席立法會事務委員會及小組委員會會議，闡釋及商討特別事項，以及協助議員審閱條例草案。

# 監控措施

金管局採用穩健有效的內部及外部監控機制，確保秉持高水平的員工操守、審慎的風險管理，以及適當的制衡。內部及外部審計職能就監控機制是否足夠及具成效提供獨立評估。

# 行為守則

《行為守則》就員工的道德與法律責任提供指引，確保所有職級員工的行為均符合指定標準。

# 內部監控

# 運作監控

作為風險管理的第一度防線，所有部門及分處均有責任評估其工作流程的風險，並制定適當的監控措施，確保金管局日常運作穩妥。

# 機構風險管理

風險管理亦在機構層面進行。由金管局總裁擔任主席的風險委員會，是機構風險管理架構的基石之一。

風險委員會審視和商討各部門所識別的潛在及新生風險，以及相關監控措施和緩解策略是否充足，並由該會定出適當的跟進行動。

# 內部審計

金管局內部審核處獨立評估不同部門的管治程序、風險管理及監控措施是否足夠及具成效，並提出改善建議。

# 外部審計

根據《外匯基金條例》第7條，外匯基金的財務報表由香港特區政府審計署審核。審計署並無就此項服務收取費用。經審核的外匯基金財務報表刊載於金管局《年報》。
